title: Can we say that falsifiability 'defines' science? - Quora

response.answer_text: Clearly, falsifiability does not define science. There is far more to science than just falsifiability. Falsifiability is only one of several useful guidelines for science. My tax returns and my stories about my sports exploits also have falsifiability. They are not scientific by any means. You are right that it is critical though, falsifiability is an excellent way to weed out pseudo scientific theories about what should be and should not be included as valid scientific research.

You could put it that way. Here’s what Wikipedia has to say on the subject: “The concern with falsifiability gained attention by way of philosopher of science Karl Popper's scientific epistemology "falsificationism". Popper stresses the problem of demarcation—distinguishing the scientific from the unscientific—and makes falsifiability the demarcation criterion, such that what is unfalsifiable is classified as unscientific, and the practice of declaring an unfalsifiable theory to be scientifically true is pseudoscience.”
